title: Why Is My Tongue Tingling?
author: Maureen Salamon

content: That pins-and-needles or numb feeling you sometimes get in your hands or feet can happen in your tongue , too. It can tingle for lots of reasons, such as accidentally biting your tongue or more serious problems, such as a stroke.
Here are some of the most common causes of a tingling tongue and how to deal with them.

Tongue tingling is a feeling of pins and needles in your tongue area. It has many causes and can be connected to many health conditions. If you feel your tongue tingling for a long time or have itching or swelling of your tongue, talk to your doctor right away. (Photo Credit: iStock/Getty Images)

content_blocks.text: That pins-and-needles or numb feeling you sometimes get in your hands or feet can happen in your tongue , too. It can tingle for lots of reasons, such as accidentally biting your tongue or more serious problems, such as a stroke.
Here are some of the most common causes of a tingling tongue and how to deal with them.

Tongue tingling is a feeling of pins and needles in your tongue area. It has many causes and can be connected to many health conditions. If you feel your tongue tingling for a long time or have itching or swelling of your tongue, talk to your doctor right away. (Photo Credit: iStock/Getty Images)

sections.heading: Canker Sore
content: These painful ulcers can pop up on the soft areas of your mouth, gums, or under the tongue. They can cause your tongue to tingle or burn, especially a day or two before the sores show up. Lots of things can cause canker sores , and most heal in about two weeks.
See your doctor if you:
bullets: Are in a lot of pain or have trouble eating or drinking

associated_bullets: Are in a lot of pain or have trouble eating or drinking

sections.heading: Lack of Vitamins or Minerals
content: If you don’t get enough of some vitamins and minerals through foods or drinks, or your body doesn’t make enough of them, you can have a variety of symptoms. One of them is a tingling in your mouth. That may happen if you lack:
See your doctor about any tingling in your tongue or mouth. They can tell if you need supplements or rule out an underactive thyroid or other issues.
bullets: Various B vitamins, including B12, which is important for your nerves

content_blocks.text: If you don’t get enough of some vitamins and minerals through foods or drinks, or your body doesn’t make enough of them, you can have a variety of symptoms. One of them is a tingling in your mouth. That may happen if you lack:
associated_bullets: Various B vitamins, including B12, which is important for your nerves

content_blocks.text: See your doctor about any tingling in your tongue or mouth. They can tell if you need supplements or rule out an underactive thyroid or other issues.

sections.heading: Allergic Reactions
content: Certain foods and medicines can lead to an itchy or tingly tongue, mouth, or throat, which may signal an allergy or sensitivity. A condition called oral allergy syndrome can make your tongue and mouth itch or swell if you eat raw fruit, vegetables, or nuts that have proteins similar to those found in allergy-causing pollen .
If an allergy or another reaction is behind your tongue tingling, you may also have:

It’s rare, but an allergic reaction can close your airways so you can’t breathe. This is an emergency. Call 911 or get to a hospital right away if your tongue itches or swells. Some people may need to carry a drug called an epinephrine autoinjector for severe reactions. For mild cases, your doctor may recommend over-the-counter or prescription antihistamines .
bullets: Swelling in your face, eyelids, lips, or tongue

sections.heading: Migraines
content: These pounding headaches can make your tongue, face, and hands numb or tingle. Doctors don’t know why this happens, but faulty electrical or chemical signals in the brain may play a role.

content_blocks.text: These pounding headaches can make your tongue, face, and hands numb or tingle. Doctors don’t know why this happens, but faulty electrical or chemical signals in the brain may play a role.

content: Other symptoms of a migraine include:

Get medical help right away if any of these symptoms are new. Prescription medications can help ease your migraines or prevent an attack. You can also try resting in a dark room, pressing a cool washcloth on your forehead or behind your neck, or using other home remedies.
bullets: Problems seeing, or having blind spots

content_blocks.text: Other symptoms of a migraine include:
associated_bullets: Problems seeing, or having blind spots

content_blocks.text: Get medical help right away if any of these symptoms are new. Prescription medications can help ease your migraines or prevent an attack. You can also try resting in a dark room, pressing a cool washcloth on your forehead or behind your neck, or using other home remedies.

sections.heading: Nerve Damage
content: This can happen after dental work or a tongue piercing. Your dentist might hit a nerve or a blood vessel while injecting a numbing drug. That could make your tongue tingle. Usually, the problem goes away on its own within several weeks.

Tongue piercings may also hurt your nerves. The damage is often temporary, but it can be permanent. You might notice that your tongue tingles, food tastes different, or you have trouble moving your tongue. The symptoms usually fade away, but see your doctor and get them checked out.

content_blocks.text: This can happen after dental work or a tongue piercing. Your dentist might hit a nerve or a blood vessel while injecting a numbing drug. That could make your tongue tingle. Usually, the problem goes away on its own within several weeks.

Tongue piercings may also hurt your nerves. The damage is often temporary, but it can be permanent. You might notice that your tongue tingles, food tastes different, or you have trouble moving your tongue. The symptoms usually fade away, but see your doctor and get them checked out.

sections.heading: Multiple Sclerosis
content: When you have multiple sclerosis (MS) , your immune system attacks the nerves in your brain and spinal cord. That can cause numbness or strange sensations, including in your tongue or face.

content_blocks.text: When you have multiple sclerosis (MS) , your immune system attacks the nerves in your brain and spinal cord. That can cause numbness or strange sensations, including in your tongue or face.

content: MS can make it harder for you to chew or swallow, increasing the risk of biting your tongue or the inner side of your cheeks. MS is a lifelong condition. So talk to your doctor about your tingling tongue and get it treated. Medication can help lower the number of symptoms and allow you to go longer between MS flares.
MS can cause many other symptoms. These may include:
Get medical help right away if you have any of these symptoms.
bullets: Urge to pee or trouble peeing

associated_bullets: Urge to pee or trouble peeing

content_blocks.text: Get medical help right away if you have any of these symptoms.

sections.heading: Stroke
content: A stroke happens when a blood clot cuts off the flow of blood to your brain . A stroke can make your tongue tingle by preventing your brain from getting enough oxygen. That can lead to problems with nerves and muscles in your face, tongue, and elsewhere.

content_blocks.text: A stroke happens when a blood clot cuts off the flow of blood to your brain . A stroke can make your tongue tingle by preventing your brain from getting enough oxygen. That can lead to problems with nerves and muscles in your face, tongue, and elsewhere.

sections.heading: Stroke
content: A stroke happens when a blood clot cuts off the flow of blood to your brain . A stroke can make your tongue tingle by preventing your brain from getting enough oxygen. That can lead to problems with nerves and muscles in your face, tongue, and elsewhere.

content_blocks.text: A stroke happens when a blood clot cuts off the flow of blood to your brain . A stroke can make your tongue tingle by preventing your brain from getting enough oxygen. That can lead to problems with nerves and muscles in your face, tongue, and elsewhere.

content: A stroke may also leave your tongue numb or hard to move. Other signs of a stroke include:
A stroke is a medical emergency. Call 911 right away. Every minute of delay may hurt your chances of survival or avoiding permanent damage.
bullets: A bad headache , especially with a stiff neck
Trouble talking or understanding what others are saying
A droop on one side of your face
Weakness or numbness in your face, arm, or leg
Trouble walking, dizziness , or balance problems

content_blocks.text: A stroke may also leave your tongue numb or hard to move. Other signs of a stroke include:
associated_bullets: A bad headache , especially with a stiff neck
Trouble talking or understanding what others are saying
A droop on one side of your face
Weakness or numbness in your face, arm, or leg
Trouble walking, dizziness , or balance problems

content_blocks.text: A stroke is a medical emergency. Call 911 right away. Every minute of delay may hurt your chances of survival or avoiding permanent damage.

sections.heading: Is a Tingling Tongue Serious?
content: Some causes of tongue tingling may be temporary, but they may interfere with your daily life. Other conditions that cause tingling or the feeling of pins and needles in your body, including the tongue, can be life-threatening if left untreated.

If you’re experiencing tongue tingling frequently, or if the tingling comes with other symptoms like weakness or loss of balance, you should talk to your doctor to confirm the cause and possible treatment. Call 911 or get to a hospital right away if your tongue itches or swells.

content_blocks.text: Some causes of tongue tingling may be temporary, but they may interfere with your daily life. Other conditions that cause tingling or the feeling of pins and needles in your body, including the tongue, can be life-threatening if left untreated.

If you’re experiencing tongue tingling frequently, or if the tingling comes with other symptoms like weakness or loss of balance, you should talk to your doctor to confirm the cause and possible treatment. Call 911 or get to a hospital right away if your tongue itches or swells.

sections.heading: Takeaways
content: Tongue tingling is a feeling of pins and needles in your tongue area. It has many causes and can be linked to several conditions, such as anxiety, dry mouth, and more. If you feel your tongue tingling for a long period, or if you have symptoms like itching or swelling of your tongue or general weakness, talk to your doctor immediately. They can help you find out the cause of the tingling and possible treatments.

content_blocks.text: Tongue tingling is a feeling of pins and needles in your tongue area. It has many causes and can be linked to several conditions, such as anxiety, dry mouth, and more. If you feel your tongue tingling for a long period, or if you have symptoms like itching or swelling of your tongue or general weakness, talk to your doctor immediately. They can help you find out the cause of the tingling and possible treatments.

sections.heading: Tingling Tongue FAQs
content: Anxiety can cause paresthesia or tingling and numbness. While your hands and feet are usually where you’ll feel the tingling, it can also happen in other areas, such as your tongue.
Dehydration can cause temporary tingling in the tongue. It can also cause dry mouth, which can lead to tingling in your tongue.
Eating pineapple might cause your tongue to tingle. Oral allergy syndrome, which can come with itching and swelling of the tongue, can be a side effect of eating pineapple.
People with MS might feel numbness in their tongue, which can make it difficult to move the tongue while talking, swallowing, or chewing.

People with MS might feel numbness in their tongue, which can make it difficult to move the tongue while talking, swallowing, or chewing.

meta_description: A tingling tongue can signal a medical problem. Some causes may be minor and temporary, but other reasons may be more serious.
